00052 //
00053 // CSoundResource Implementation

00057 //
00058 // CSoundResource::CSoundResource                       - Chapter 12, page 393
00059 //
00060 CSoundResource::CSoundResource(const std::wstring & soundFile)
00061 :       m_PCMBuffer(NULL),
00062         m_PCMBufferSize(0),
00063         m_SoundType(SOUND_TYPE_UNKNOWN),
00064         m_SoundFile(soundFile),
00065         m_bInitialized(false),
00066         m_LengthMilli(0)
00067 {       
00068         // don't do anything yet - timing sound Initialization is important!
00069 }
00070 
00071 //
00072 // CSoundResource::~CSoundResource                      - Chapter 12, page 394
00073 //
00074 CSoundResource::~CSoundResource()
00075 {
00076         // Note - since CSoundResources have a lifetime controlled by shared_ptr, 
00077         // it's safe for us to nuke the memory without checking the sound system first.
00078 
00079         //Once the buffer is deleted, anything trying to read from it will result
00080         //in an Access Violation, like if the sound is still being played in another thread
00081         //So... that means don't try to play this sound anymore after you SAFE_DELETE this buffer
00082 
00083         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY(m_PCMBuffer);
00084 }
00085 
00086 //
00087 // CSoundResource::VInitialize                          - Chapter 12, page 394
00088 //
00089 bool CSoundResource::VInitialize()
00090 {
00091         if (!m_bInitialized)
00092         {
00093                 m_SoundType = CAudio::FindSoundTypeFromFile(m_SoundFile.c_str());
00094                 FILE *file = _wfopen(m_SoundFile.c_str(), _T("rb"));
00095                 if (file ==  NULL )
00096                 {
00097                         return FALSE;
00098                 }
00099 
00100                 switch (m_SoundType)
00101                 {
00102                         case SOUND_TYPE_WAVE:
00103                                 ParseWave(file);
00104                                 break;
00105 
00106                         case SOUND_TYPE_OGG:
00107                                 ParseOgg(file);
00108                                 break;
00109 
00110                         default:
00111                                 assert(0 && _T("Sound Type Not Supported"));
00112                 }
00113 
00114                 fclose(file);
00115                 m_bInitialized = true;
00116                 m_LengthMilli = ( GetPCMBufferSize() * 1000 ) / GetFormat()->nAvgBytesPerSec;
00117         }
00118         return true;
00119 }
00120 
00121 //
00122 // CSoundResource::ParseWave                            - Chapter 12, page 396
00123 //
00124 bool CSoundResource::ParseWave(FILE *fd)
00125 {
00126         DWORD           file = 0; 
00127         DWORD           fileEnd = 0; 
00128         
00129         DWORD           length = 0;     
00130         DWORD           type = 0;                                                                       
00131 
00132         fseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
00133 
00134         // mmioFOURCC -- converts four chars into a 4 byte integer code.
00135         // The first 4 bytes of a valid .wav file is 'R','I','F','F'
00136         fread(&type, 1, sizeof(DWORD), fd);
00137         if(type != mmioFOURCC('R', 'I', 'F', 'F'))
00138                 return false;   
00139         
00140         fread(&length, 1, sizeof(DWORD), fd); // The first integer after RIFF is the length
00141         fread(&type, 1, sizeof(DWORD), fd);   // The second is the block type - another code, expect.
00142                                                         // 'W','A','V','E' for a legal .wav file
00143 
00144         if(type != mmioFOURCC('W', 'A', 'V', 'E'))
00145                 return false;           //not a WAV
00146 
00147         // Find the end of the file
00148         fileEnd = length - 4;
00149         
00150         // Load the .wav format and the .wav data
00151         // Note that these blocks can be in either order.
00152         while(file < fileEnd)
00153         {
00154                 fread(&type, 1, sizeof(DWORD), fd);   
00155                 file += sizeof(DWORD);
00156 
00157                 fread(&length, 1, sizeof(DWORD), fd);   
00158                 file += sizeof(DWORD);
00159 
00160                 switch(type)
00161                 {
00162                         case mmioFOURCC('f', 'm', 't', ' '):
00163                         {
00164                                 fread(&m_WavFormatEx, 1, length, fd);   
00165                                 m_WavFormatEx.cbSize = length;
00166                                 break;
00167                         }
00168 
00169                         case mmioFOURCC('d', 'a', 't', 'a'):
00170                         {
00171                                 m_PCMBuffer = GCC_NEW char[length];
00172                                 m_PCMBufferSize = length;
00173                                 size_t bytesRead = fread(m_PCMBuffer, 1, (unsigned int)length, fd);   
00174                                 if (bytesRead < (unsigned int)length)
00175                                 {
00176                                         assert(0 && _T("Couldn't read the sound data!"));
00177                                         return false;
00178                                 }
00179                                 break;
00180                         }
00181                 } 
00182 
00183                 file += length;
00184 
00185                 // If both blocks have been seen, we can return true.
00186                 if (m_PCMBuffer && m_PCMBufferSize!=0)
00187                         return true;
00188 
00189                 // Increment the pointer past the block we just read,
00190                 // and make sure the pointer is byte aliged.
00191                 if (length & 1)
00192                 {
00193                         char temp;
00194                         fread(&temp, 1, 1, fd);   
00195                         file ++;
00196                 }
00197         } 
00198 
00199         // If we get to here, the .wav file didn't contain all the right pieces.
00200         return false; 
00201 }
00202 
00203 //
00204 // CSoundResource::ParseOgg                             - Chapter 12, page 398
00205 //
00206 bool CSoundResource::ParseOgg(FILE *fd)
00207 {
00208     OggVorbis_File vf;                     // for the vorbisfile interface
00209 
00210     ov_open(fd, &vf, NULL, 0);
00211 
00212     // ok now the tricky part
00213     // the vorbis_info struct keeps the most of the interesting format info
00214     vorbis_info *vi = ov_info(&vf,-1);
00215 
00216     memset(&m_WavFormatEx, 0, sizeof(m_WavFormatEx));
00217 
00218     m_WavFormatEx.cbSize          = sizeof(m_WavFormatEx);
00219     m_WavFormatEx.nChannels       = vi->channels;
00220     m_WavFormatEx.wBitsPerSample  = 16;                    // ogg vorbis is always 16 bit
00221     m_WavFormatEx.nSamplesPerSec  = vi->rate;
00222     m_WavFormatEx.nAvgBytesPerSec = m_WavFormatEx.nSamplesPerSec*m_WavFormatEx.nChannels*2;
00223     m_WavFormatEx.nBlockAlign     = 2*m_WavFormatEx.nChannels;
00224     m_WavFormatEx.wFormatTag      = 1;
00225 
00226         DWORD   size = 4096 * 16;
00227     DWORD   pos = 0;
00228     int     sec = 0;
00229     int     ret = 1;
00230     
00231         //Thanks to Kain for fixing this bug!
00232         //DWORD bytes = (DWORD)ov_pcm_total(&vf, -1);                   // get the total number of PCM samples
00233         DWORD bytes = (DWORD)ov_pcm_total(&vf, -1);    bytes *= 2 * vi->channels;
00234         m_PCMBuffer = GCC_NEW char[bytes];
00235         m_PCMBufferSize = bytes;
00236 
00237     // now read in the bits
00238     while(ret && pos<bytes)
00239     {
00240         ret = ov_read(&vf, m_PCMBuffer+pos, size, 0, 2, 1, &sec);
00241         pos += ret;
00242                 if (bytes - pos < size)
00243                 {
00244                         size = bytes - pos;
00245                 }
00246     }
00247 
00248         ov_clear(&vf);
00249         fclose(fd);
00250 
00251         return true;
00252 }
